intro: Lindsaea lapeyrousei subsp. lapeyrousei, commonly known as the Lapeyrouse's mistletoe, is a hemi-parasitic plant belonging to the family Onocophoraceae. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pale green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients from the host while performing photosynthesis. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
